article_headline: Indian reservations Visually impaired man may pay property tax sues race organizers
article_text: WASHINGTON (AP) — States and counties may impose property taxes on Indian reservation land privately owned by Native Americans, the Supreme Court ruled today. By an 8-1 vote, the justices upheld such a tax imposed by Yakima County, Wash., on land within the Yakima Indian Reservation. But, by a separate, unanimous vote, the court barred the county from imposing an excise tax on the sale of such privately owned — or “fee” — land. SACRAMENTO (AP) — A visually impaired Sacramento athlete is suing Eppie s Great Race for barring him last year from part of the triathlon because of his disability. John Adams said in his suit filed in Sacramento Superior Court that race directors refused to allow him to participate in the bicycle portion of the July event.
